noun.description: An object or space used to contain something.
An electrical outlet into which the plug of an electrical device may be inserted.
An organ or structure which receives a secretion, eggs, sperm, etc.
An enlarged area at the apex of a stem that bears the organs of a flower or the florets of a flower head.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin receptaculum, from receptare receive back, frequentative of recipere (see receive).
